logic

Class DynamicBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Gameboard
      • logic.DynamicBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PatternLoader, Ruleset

    public class DynamicBoard
extends Gameboard
implements Ruleset
    A representation of the Game of Life with dynamic implementation allowing the board to expand. The Dynamic Board uses Generation-objects to represent the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DynamicBoard

        public DynamicBoard(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        Constructor Class constructor with GrahpicsContexts as argument to enable drawing-calls on canvas. Sets the current Generation to the prefered type. Creates a Generation Manager object to manage the generation-objects. Sets default Game of Life rules.
        Parameters:
        gc - GraphicsContext

    • Method Detail

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()
        Method for resetting the board to default status. clears population so that there are no living cells draws an empty population resets the counter for living cells and sets it. resets the generation counter sets default rules for the game. sets the movement done by user equal zero so that the drawing-area is centered. sets the drawing-area and the currentGen-area back to default(25).
        Specified by:
        resetBoard in class Gameboard

      • setConwayRules

        public void setConwayRules()
        Creates new boolean array with default conway rules

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset()
        Sets the offsets in x- and y-direction. Everything that uses offsets are centered in the middle.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Uses clear rect to remove overlay Iterates through the keys of the living cells hashmap and draws Uses cellsize*0.9 in order to make some whitespace in-between cells Saves the generation in the generation-pool. Checks to see the status of the grid (on/off).
        Specified by:
        draw in class Gameboard

      • drawLoaded

        public void drawLoaded()
        Draws the pattern loaded in by user, either through URL or as a RLE file. Uses 2D representation to load pattern. Every living cell is set to grey with opacity-level 0.8, and every dead cell is transparent.
        Specified by:
        drawLoaded in interface PatternLoader
        See Also:
        PatternLoader.glueLoaded()

      • displayNextGen

        public void displayNextGen()
        Calls the calcNextGen method and sets the current Generation-object equal to the next generation-object. Increases the generation counter by 1 and sets living cells Calls the draw method to show user the new generation.
        Specified by:
        displayNextGen in class Gameboard

      • changeCellStatus

        public void changeCellStatus(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
        Takes a mouse event as argument Gets the coordinate of the mouse event. Casts it to int and diviveds by the cell size in order to get the corresponding cell to become alive/die. An if-test checks to see if the mouse event is within the canvas and area-size. An if-test to see whether it is right or left mouse dragged.
        Right mousedragged = create living cell
        Left mousedragged = remove living cell
        Specified by:
        changeCellStatus in class Gameboard
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent

      • drawGrid

        public void drawGrid()
        Draws a grid using horizontal and vertical lines. The constant -1.8 makes sure that the living cells matches the grid-lines. The offsets and moveX are used to make the grids position correct relative to userinputs. The grid also makes a visualisation of the drawable-area.

      • decodeRuleset

        public void decodeRuleset(java.lang.String ruleB,
                          java.lang.String ruleS)
        Decodes rulesets from userinput and File/URL IO This ruleset is being used in the calcNextGen method. It allows a diffrent variation of the game. The input is checked with a matcher, and throws PatternFormatException if the ruleset was invalid.
        Specified by:
        decodeRuleset in interface Ruleset
        Parameters:
        ruleB - String that contains number chars. Representing when a cell should be born.
        ruleS - String that contains number chars. Representing when a cell should survive.

      • updateBoardWithPattern

        public void updateBoardWithPattern(byte[][] input)
        Sets the loaded pattern equal to the pattern instance-variable. Allows user to manipulate the loaded pattern.
        Specified by:
        updateBoardWithPattern in interface PatternLoader
        Parameters:
        input, - 2D-array representation
        See Also:
        PatternLoader.setStartIndexLoaded(), PatternLoader.drawLoaded()

      • setStartIndexLoaded

        public void setStartIndexLoaded()
        Sets the start-position for the loaded patterns relative to the board size. Makes the loaded pattern appear in the center of the draw-able area (grid).
        Specified by:
        setStartIndexLoaded in interface PatternLoader
        See Also:
        PatternLoader.moveLoaded(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent), PatternLoader.drawLoaded(), PatternLoader.glueLoaded()

      • glueLoaded

        public void glueLoaded()
        Glues the loaded pattern to the board by converting the indecies of the living cells in the 2D-array and adding their integer-value to the population map. Their placement in the map is determined by the movement done by user. Sets living cells and draws the loaded pattern with "living" color.
        Specified by:
        glueLoaded in interface PatternLoader

      • navigateBoard

        public void navigateBoard(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent e)
        Allows the user to move the board around, by using the keyboard.
        key T: move the board upwards.
        key G: move the board downwards.
        key F: move the board to the left.
        key H: move the board to the right.
        Parameters:
        e - e KeyEvent allowing user input from keyboard.

      • rotateLoaded

        public void rotateLoaded()
        Rotates the loaded pattern in the clockwise direction by transposing the 2D-array and reversing each row.
        Specified by:
        rotateLoaded in interface PatternLoader

      • setBorn

        public void setBorn(boolean[] birth)
        Sets the rules for how many living cells a dead cell needs in order to become alive in the next generation. Every cell can have 0-8 neighbours.
        Specified by:
        setBorn in interface Ruleset
        Parameters:
        birth - is a boolean[9].

      • setSurvives

        public void setSurvives(boolean[] surviving)
        Sets the rules for how many living cells a living cell needs in order to survive through to the next generation. Every cell can have 0-8 neighbours.
        Specified by:
        setSurvives in interface Ruleset
        Parameters:
        surviving - is a boolean[9].

      • changeBoardSize

        public void changeBoardSize()
        Checks if the input is valid. If invalid, an alertbox will show. We set the cap of our board to 25000x25000. The input also has to be an even number since the board expands +1 in both x- and y-direction. If the board is expanded, the living cells maintain their relative position. If the board-size is set less then its current size, every living cell is removed and then the board-size is reset.
        Specified by:
        changeBoardSize in class Gameboard
